issue.title: [CF 1017] [patch] track combo points on player, even with no target
issue.body:
combo points on the player can be obtained with UnitPower("player", 4)

I hacked Components/IconTypes/IconType_value/value.lua in the quickest and dirtiest way possible, to see if it would work:

-- line 156
            elseif PowerType == 100 then -- combo points
--                value, maxValue = GetComboPoints("player", "target"), 5
                value, maxValue = UnitPower("player", 4), 5

It does work.  You'll probably want to take out all the special-casing of combo points and just have them go through the same codepath as other player resources, now that they are a player resource, not a target thing, so I didn't bother to make an actual diff of just changing one line.

I've been playing around with using TMW to make bars to track my health and energy, and combo points, on my lowbie rogue.  I should maybe just get a unit frames mod instead of implementing it myself with TMW, and get back the screen real estate from where I also have the blizz-UI self / target portraits.  But I'm so used to them. :P


> Posted by CurseForge user Karsteck | Imported from CurseForge issue #1017 | Raw
